questions.question: Cu^2+ + KCN (in excess) → soluble complex (X). How many statements are correct regarding complex (X)? (i) The central atom has a coordination number of 6. (ii) The central atom has a coordination number of 4. (iii) The complex is square planar. (iv) The complex is diamagnetic. (v) The complex is paramagnetic.
BiCl3 → black ppt (M) → soluble complex (N). Find the number of moles of I^- ions involved for the formation of per mole of (N).

Sn^2+ and Sn^4+ can be distinguished by how many of the following methods? (i) By passing H2S in their solution (in acidic medium). (ii) By addition of NaOH in their solution. (iii) By addition of excess NaOH in their solution. (iv) By addition of dil. HCl in their solution. (v) By addition of HgCl2 solution in their solution.
